current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To restrict the sale, lease, transfer, retransfer, or
		  delivery of F–16 aircraft, M1 tanks, or certain other defense articles or
		  services to the Government of Egypt.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that the Government of Egypt has agreed—

text.#text:
The
			 United States Government may not allow the sale, lease, transfer, retransfer,
			 or delivery of F–16 aircraft, M1 tanks, or certain other defense articles or
			 services to the Government of Egypt until the

header.#text:
Restriction on certain
			 military sales to Egypt

text.#text:
to continue to uphold its commitments under
			 the Camp David Peace Accords;

to provide proper security at United States
			 embassies and consulates pursuant to the Vienna Convention on Consular
			 Relations, done at Vienna April 24, 1963; and

to bring stability to Egypt by ending its
			 systematic exclusion and silencing of all official minority political
			 opposition and taking concrete steps to engage in dialogue with such opposition
			 parties and consider a coalition, power-sharing government with such opposition
			 parties.
